title: How to Start Firefox in Safe Mode

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Click or double-click the Firefox app icon, which resembles an orange fox wrapped around a blue globe. If you can't open Firefox due to issues for which you want to start Firefox in Safe Mode, skip ahead to the Windows or Mac method.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . It's in the top-right corner of the Firefox page. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu to appear.

steps.title: Click Help.
steps.content: Click Help . You'll find this option at the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Restart with Add-ons Disabled.
steps.content: Click Restart with Add-ons Disabled . It's at the top of the "Help" section of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Restart when prompted.
steps.content: Click Restart when prompted. Doing so will close Firefox.

steps.title: Click Start in Safe Mode when prompted.
steps.content: Click Start in Safe Mode when prompted. This will prompt Firefox to re-open in Safe Mode.

steps.title: Review your browser's performance.
steps.content: Review your browser's performance. If Firefox's issues disappear while in Safe Mode, one or more of the add-ons you've installed is causing the issues.

steps.title: Disable add-ons if necessary.
steps.content: Disable add-ons if necessary. Go to the add-ons page by clicking ☰ , clicking Add-ons , and clicking the Extensions tab, then click Disable or Remove to the right of an add-on to either turn it off or delete it from Firefox. You can also reset your entire browser to its default settings by clicking Restart with Add-ons Disabled , clicking Refresh Firefox when prompted, and clicking Refresh Firefox when asked again. This will remove all of your browser's settings and add-ons.

steps.title: Try using a keyboard shortcut.
steps.content: Try using a keyboard shortcut. In most cases, you can use a keyboard shortcut to open Firefox in Safe Mode. Find the Firefox icon on your desktop, in your taskbar, or in the Start menu; once you've found it, do the following: Hold down ⇧ Shift . Click or double-click the Firefox app icon. Release ⇧ Shift when Firefox opens. Click Start in Safe Mode when prompted. Troubleshoot Firefox as needed.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen. A pop-up window will appear.

steps.title: Open Command Prompt.
steps.content: Open Command Prompt. Type in command prompt , then click Command Prompt at the top of the Start window.

steps.title: Enter the Firefox Safe Mode command.
steps.content: Enter the Firefox Safe Mode command. Type in "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe" -safe-mode into Command Prompt. If you installed Firefox in a different folder than the one that was recommended, you can try typing in start firefox -safe-mode instead.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . Doing so will run the command.

steps.title: Click Start in Safe Mode when prompted.
steps.content: Click Start in Safe Mode when prompted. This will confirm your decision and open Firefox in Safe Mode, at which point you can proceed with troubleshooting your add-ons as necessary. If you receive an error or you're not prompted to start Firefox in Safe Mode, try typing "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe" -safe-mode into Command Prompt and pressing ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Try using a keyboard shortcut.
steps.content: Try using a keyboard shortcut. In most cases, you can use a keyboard shortcut to open Firefox in Safe Mode. Find the Firefox icon in your Mac's Applications folder, in the Dock, or in Launchpad, then do the following: Hold down the ⌥ Option key. Click (or double-click) Firefox. Release the ⌥ Option key when Firefox opens. Click Start in Safe Mode when prompted. Troubleshoot Firefox as needed.

steps.title: Open Spotlight .
steps.content: Open Spotlight . Click the magnifying glass-shaped icon in the top-right corner of the screen. A text box will appear.

steps.title: Open Terminal.
steps.content: Open Terminal. Type in terminal in Spotlight, then double-click Terminal in the resulting list of apps.

steps.title: Enter the Firefox Safe Mode command.
steps.content: Enter the Firefox Safe Mode command. Type /Applications/Firefox.app/Contents/MacOS/firefox -safe-mode into Terminal.

steps.title: Press ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Press ⏎ Return . Doing so runs your command.

steps.title: Click Start in Safe Mode when prompted.
steps.content: Click Start in Safe Mode when prompted. This will confirm your decision and open Firefox in Safe Mode, at which point you can proceed with troubleshooting your add-ons as necessary.
